Package.Name: remote communication between WoT client and WWISE Authoring Tools
sound events logging in the xvm.log
statistics colorscale
Package.Description: Choose which color scale you use to display player's tank stats

Package.Name: no change (using the selected config's colorscale or the default one)
Battle Results
Package.Description:
Show the tier of the battle (max tier)
also change which results page is displayed first when you enter the garage from the battle
page 1 is battle summary
page 2 is teams score
page 3 is your detailed battle stats

Package.Name: Battle Results Page
Package.Description:
changes which results page is displayed first when you enter the garage from the battle
page 1 is battle summary
page 2 is teams score
page 3 is your detailed battle stats

Package.Name: init page 1
Package.Description: Show the first tab in the results page. (Game summary)

Package.Name: init page 2
Package.Description: Show the second tab in the results page. (Total team information)

Package.Name: init page 3
Package.Description: Show the third tab in the results page. (Battle finances report)

Package.Name: shots precision and damage in first page under credits and XP
Package.Description: display shots precision and damage in first page under credits and XP

Package.Name: totals for your battle efficiency in first page
Package.Description: show totals for your battle efficiency in first page

Package.Description: display net income of credits in first page

Package.Name: Carousel
Package.Description: Change many settings about how the tank carousel is displayed in your garage.

Package.Name: disable XVM tank slot informations (use default)

Package.Name: enable XVM tank slot information
Package.Description: Enable the XVM carousel

Package.Name: Slot content
Package.Description: Change the content inside the tank cells

Package.Name: modify default slots
Package.Description: Use the carousel cell settings from the xvm config you selected in the XVM prebuilt configs tab

Package.Name: 1.0 Scale
Package.Description: Normal size of the carousel

Package.Name: 0.8 scale
Package.Description: Reduce the size of the carousel overall by a factor of 0.8

Package.Name: 0.6 scale
Package.Description: Reduce the size of the carousel overall by a factor of 0.6

Package.Name: colorize names for tanks with limited matchmaking
Package.Description: Shows the tankname in the tankcarousel with limited Matchmaking in different colors

Package.Description: Shows the tankname in the tankcarousel with limited Matchmaking in different colors

Package.Description: Shows the tankname in the tankcarousel with limited Matchmaking in Green color

Package.Name: red
Package.Description: Shows the tankname in the tankcarousel with limited Matchmaking in different colors

Package.Name: yellow
Package.Description: Shows the tankname in the tankcarousel with limited Matchmaking in different colors

Package.Name: by CaronteShinigami
Package.Description: Use the carousel cell settings donated to us from CaronteShinigami

Package.Name: 1.0 Scale
Package.Description: Normal carousell cell size

Package.Name: 0.8 Scale
Package.Description: Reduce the size of the carousel overall by a factor of 0.8

Package.Name: colorize names for tanks with limited matchmaking
"MaxData" by DivingDuck
Package.Description:
1. chevron indicates players overall WN8 rating
2. chevron indicates average damage for this tank
3. chevron indicates efficiency for this tank

 The green square indicates 1MoE, the two grey squares indicate that 2MoE are still missing. ;)

The 3 icons in the lower right show which camo is installed.

Package.Name: colorize names for tanks with limited matchmaking
smaller gap
Package.Description: smaller gap between the different tank fields

Package.Name: Relhax developers configs of the MaxData carousel (thx@DivingDuck)
Package.Description:
1. chevron indicates players overall WN8 rating
2. chevron indicates average damage for this tank
3. chevron indicates efficiency for this tank

 The green square indicates 1MoE, the two grey squares indicate that 2MoE are still missing. ;)

The 3 icons in the lower right show which camo is installed.

Package.Name: dirty20067´s "MaxData" version with different features - 0.8 Scale
Package.Description:
dirty20067´s "MaxData" version with the following features:

- showing Tanknames in "Dodger Blue" color, which have limited matchmaking
- Scale 0.8 with bigger font (same like Scale 1.0 has)
- alternative flags

Package.Name: elektrosmoker´s "MaxData" version with alternative Flags - 1.0 Scale

Clock
Package.Description: Enable or disable the clock in the garage. Also select 12 or 24 hour clock, or blue text of the clock

Package.Name: Change Color to Blue
Package.Description: Changes the color of the clock to Blue.

Package.Name: Bonds Locker
Package.Description: Prevents you from using bonds in your garage

Package.Description: Prevent you from using free xp in your garage

Package.Description: Prevents you from using gold in your garage

Package.Name: Block vehicle if ammo is lower than...
Package.Description: Prevent you from entering a battle if you vehicle is low on ammo

Package.Name: "Combat Intelligence" - notifications in the main window and counters in the menu
Package.Description: currently we do not offer the option for disabling combat intelligence notifications in the main window.\nbut disabling the counter for unread messages is possible.

Package.Name: display pop-up messages in the hangar
display unread notifications counter in the menu
Number of perks to show without grouping
Crew Auto-return
Package.Description: Automatically return your crew between tanks

Package.Name: return crew check box is selected by default
Saves Crew Auto Return & Tanks marked as Reserve
Mastery Mark in Tech Tree
Package.Description: Show the mastery icons for each tank in the tech tree

Package.Name: Notifications counters in the main menu
Removable equipment auto-return
Package.Description: automatically return removable equipment

Package.Name: restore selected battle type on switching to another server (only random, frontline and rank battle modes)
"Create squad" text on the squad creation button
promo of premium vehicle (on the background in the hangar)
info window with list of received awards for "Reward for Merit"
Server Ping
Package.Description: Shows the ping delay (in ms) of the server(s)

Package.Name: Server Populations
Package.Description: Display number of people on the server

Package.Name: vehicle level AND minimal - maximal vehicle battle tier
Session Info
Package.Description: this show your current session´s time, win count and win percent.\r\nthis also disables the text for the battle type selector button for better placement.

Package.Name: Garage Statistics
Package.Description: Toggle a text field in the middle-right of the screen showing stasticts of your current win rate, and how many more wins to X percent.

Package.Name: alternative position
Package.Description: this will move the xvm statistics widget in the garage to the "menubar" on top.\r\nthis also disables the text for the create squad button for better placement.

Package.Name: Tank History Informer in Garage by HAWG
Package.Description:
This is a Tank History Informer.
Now you can see what year your tank was developed in and you also can see if your tank is real or never was built.

Yellow years represents real working tanks that the tank blueprints was developed in .
The Purple years represents that the tank was never made , just blueprints of tank or prototype was never complete .

Yellow Year = R﻿eal
Purple Year = Not Real

In battle you also can see History informer for your tank

Package.Name: Tech Tree free XP convert option
Package.Description: Enable an option where, when trying to research a module or tank, if you do not have enough xp, it will present you with a window to convert enough free xp to research the item

Package.Name: combine icons of equipment and optional devices into one row
hide text at bottom of tooltip showing quantity of used eqipment, optional devices and crew
display of missing experience to unlock vehicles
initial page for other players service records
initial page for current user service record
show xTE column in the vehicle list
set the default focus to the filter text input
enable filter tanks in hangar by default
Login
Package.Description: Make changes to the login screen.

Package.Name: Auto-login
Package.Description: Automatiacly log into the game

Package.Name: Hide the old replay confirmation window
Package.Description: Will not ask you if you want to confirm loading an old version replay. Will load it automaticly.

Package.Name: Show server ping
Package.Description: Show server pings from the login screen

Package.Name: Save last server
Package.Description: Save the last server that you logged into

Package.Name: Show server populations
Package.Description: Show the servers population in the login screen

Package.Name: Battle Chat
Package.Description: modify the battlechat

Package.Name: WN8-ChatColor
Package.Description: the writer´s name is colored in his wn8color

Package.Name: 6th sense - Icon Duration
Package.Description: Configure how long the 6th sense icon stays on your screen.\nIf you later select 6th sense settings in the 6th sense tab, this is automaticaly turned off.

Package.Name: Aim Info
Package.Description: Shows aim info during the battle:\nDistance, Shell travel time, Aim Time

Package.Name: Assist Log
Package.Description: shows a log for dealt damage with your assistance

Package.Name: hide trajectory view
Package.Description: hide the tips aiming mode changing in strategic mode

Package.Name: hide siege indicator
Package.Description: hide the tips about switching to siege mode and changing the driving mode (for wheeled vehicles)

Package.Name: hide quest progress
Package.Description: hide the tips about switching to menu Personal Missions

Package.Name: hide help screen
Package.Description: hide the tips of the transition to the window of exploring the features of the machine (for wheeled vehicles)

Package.Name: enable; but hide own progress bar
Damage Indicator + (this is an additional indicator, you still can choose one from "Ingame Info")
Package.Description: shows a highlighted image when you get shot and are looking directly into that direction where the shot came from

Package.Name: Damage Log
Package.Description: Toggle the xvm damage log. The damage log shows how much damage you have taken for the duration of the battle.

Package.Name: move DamageLog in Battle (CTRL+Mouse)
Package.Description: Enabling this will allow you to move the xvm damagelog. \nWhile holding CTRL, click and drag the label with your mouse

Package.Name: Enable toggling of client default damagelog from game settings
Package.Description: Enabling this will allow you to configure the ingame damagelog and hitlog settings from the client settings window.

Package.Name: Damage Panel Repair Timers
Package.Description: Shows a number in the picture of the damaged modules in the players panel of how much time until the item is repaired.

Package.Name: DebugPanel
Package.Description: Show FPS / Ping / Clock in upper left corner.

Package.Name: v3 by Ress
Package.Description:
Show FPS / Ping / Clock in upper left corner.
by Ress

Not compatible to some XVM PreBuiltConfigs

Package.Name: High Caliber Tracker
Package.Description: Shows how much damage you need to do to get high caliber

Package.Name: Hitlog
Package.Description: Toggle the xvm hitlog (Shows a log of total damage you have caused for the duration of the game)

Package.Name: Hull-Info by HAWG
Package.Description: This will display your hull armor in battle .

Package.Name: HP Bar
Package.Description: shows a health bar at the bottom under the consumables

Package.Name: Default
Package.Description: shows a health bar at the bottom under the consumables

Package.Name: Small
Package.Description: shows a small health bar at the bottom under the consumables

Package.Name: MIAPAK
Package.Description:
disable following with xvm config builder:
 totalHP


note: not right implemented yet - little alpha/shadow/color bug

Package.Name: Last Hit Announcer
Package.Description: Will display a message of who just shot you and for how much. Similar to the damage announce part of the popular "Damagelog by GambitER".

Package.Name: InfoPanel
Package.Description: shows a tankinfopanel like the ones chooseable in IngameInfo

Package.Name: InfoPanel masheene
Package.Description: shows a tankinfopanel like the oldskool one in IngameInfo

Package.Name: Minimap Dead Switch
Package.Description: enable/disable switching between players on the minimap after death.

Package.Name: Information Label for Missions (Mission Tracker)
Package.Description:
This label positioned under the left PlayersPanel shows you many informations you need for missions or for your daily games too. 
Examples for that are your damage, damage of your platoon members, damage of you and your platoon members together, number of enemys you spotted, number of critical hits you made, number of enemys your complete platoon killed, damage through reconnaissance and chain destruction, damage through spotting only, damage through chain destruction only, damage you got, hits you got and damage you blocked. 

Information Label for Missions by MarsOne: http://forum.worldoftanks.eu/index.php?/topic/340002-09151-omc-modpack-installer-mit-bild-video-vorschau-letztes-update-siehe-wwwodemmortiscom/page__st__4980__pid__13912513#entry13912513

Package.Name: Piercing Chance (possible Penetration Indicator conflict!)
Package.Description:
This mod shows if you have a chance to penetrate the enemy.



colors:
green = chance to pierce
red = no chance to pierce

Package.Name: penetration / target armor
Package.Description: format: \ncurrent own gun penetration / actual enemy armor

Package.Name: penetration / target armor / pen chance in percent
Package.Description: format: \ncurrent own gun penetration / actual enemy armor / pen chance in percent

Package.Name: pen chance in percent
Package.Description: format: \nonly pen chance in percent

Package.Name: Postmortem Tips
Package.Description: disable/enable pop-up panel at the bottom after death

Package.Name: PreBattleMessages
Package.Description: modify the look of the pre-battle timer and messages

Package.Name: only timer & conditions
Package.Description:
disables PreBattleBackground (shadow), 
PreBattleMessages 
and 
QuestProgressHint

leaves Timer and BattleWinConditions!

Package.Name: Repair Control
Package.Description: shows a centered repair rose

Package.Name: Scoreboard
Package.Description: Configure the scoreboard (the topmost interface component showing both teams alive or dead tanks)

Package.Name: Show Alive
Package.Description: Show the number of tanks alive.

Package.Name: Show Kills
Package.Description: Show the number of tanks killed.

Package.Name: Speed of current tank by HAWG
Package.Description: This is Speed.xc the xc file will show your tanks top speed forward and reverse , above the damage panel.\r\n\r\nYou will always know what your tanks top speed is .

Package.Name: Squadmember Color Change
Package.Description: Changes the default color, if Platoon members hit an enemy.

Package.Name: Purple
Package.Description: Changes the default color to Purple, if Platoon members hit an enemy.

Package.Name: Target Info
Package.Description: shows the current targets reloadtime (no countdown, only standard reloadtime without perks)

Package.Name: Total Efficiency
Package.Description: Shows spotting damage, assistance damage, stun damage, etc.

Package.Name: move the total efficiency label
Package.Description: this moves the "total efficiency" label from the top to a different position

Package.Name: under the chat (bottom left)
Package.Description: this moves the Total Efficiency to the space between chat and damage panel

Package.Name: above damagelog
Package.Description: this moves the Total Efficiency to the bottom above the xvm damage log

Package.Name: Total HP
Package.Description: Shows the total combined hp of each team. Commonly under the scoreboard, in the format "our hp > their hp".

Package.Name: Vehicle On Fire Announcer
Package.Description: (Another) Visual notification if your vehicle is on fire.

Package.Name: WN8 Comparison
Package.Description: Shows the total WN8 values of each team. In the similar format of "Total HP" (the setting above).
Package.UpdateComment: keep this above damagepanel in db!!

Package.Name: WN8 Comparison (Standard)
Package.Description: Shows the total WN8 values of each team. In the similar format of "Total HP" (the setting above).

Package.Name: WN8 Comparison by Slava7572
Package.Description: Shows the total WN8 values of each team\nby Slava7572

Package.Description: enable/disable dimming and greening in sniper scope

Package.Name: recoil effect (for the enabled dynamic camera option)
Package.Description: enable/disable the shot recoil effect (for the enabled dynamic camera option)

Package.Name: red flash when enemy hit your tank
Package.Description: enable/disable red flash when enemy hit your tank

Package.Name: use the same Clan Icons that were last installed
Package.Description: To save time with your installation of clan icons, you could check this option to recycle/move the last installed icons to the new installation.

Package.Name: show PlayersIcon in new field (right to ClanIcons)
Package.Description:
to see plaers icons, you need to put pictures with the ingame name of the player into the following directrory:

EU:
..\World_of_Tankses_mods\mods\shared_resources\xvmes\clanicons\EU
ick

NA:
..\World_of_Tankses_mods\mods\shared_resources\xvmes\clanicons\NA
ick

RU:
..\World_of_Tankses_mods\mods\shared_resources\xvmes\clanicons\RU
ick


CT is also possible:
..\World_of_Tankses_mods\mods\shared_resources\xvmes\clanicons\CT
ick

Package.Name: change the in-battle color of enemy names to violet/blue
Package.Description: changes the normal enemy color from red to a better viewable violett/blue color for colorblind people .

Package.Name: Map Border Color
Package.Description: change the color of map borders

Package.Name: Over-Taget-Marker OTM
Package.Description: Toggle the xvm markers in the game. Disabling them will enable the configurations in the game

Package.Name: Disabled (Use stock WoT markers)
Package.Description: Allows you to use the stock markers in the game. Also enables you to configure the markers using the ingame settings.

Package.Name: Enable Quick Color Marker (Quickstat)
Package.Description: from left to right: WN8, EFF, global winrate, winrate on the current tank

Package.Name: red OMC-SKULL on enemies & ANGELWINGS on allies
Package.Description:
Shows ANGELWINGS on over-target-markers when allies get killed.
Shows RED OMC SKULL on over-target-marker when enemies getkilled.
Shows NUKE on over-target-marker when enemies get ammo-racked.

NOT COMPATIBLE TO gravestone VARIANT

Package.Name: GRAVESTONE (on enemies) by BoingPlatsch
Package.Description: Shows a gravestone kill symbol on enemies

Package.Name: Player's position in the beginning of battle (for CW) [doesnt work with all marker styles]
Minimap
Package.Description: Make changes to the minimap in the game.

Package.Name: Zoom
Package.Description: Change the key that shows minimap zoom

Package.Name: hotkey - Left ALT [possible conflicts with other mod´s hotkeys]
Use Circles defined in default/prebuilt selection
Disable (Use WoT playerspanel)
Package.Description: Use the stock WoT playerspanel

Package.Name: Enable
Package.Description: Use the XVM players panel

Package.Name: Starting Position
Package.Description: Choose with which Players Panel position with which the game will start.

Package.Name: SMALL
Package.Description: Enable a small HP bar in the players panel for every tank.

Package.Name: outside PlayersPanel
Package.Description: Choose which HP bars you want to use

Package.Name: default
Package.Description: Use the HP bars from the XVM config you selected in the Prebuilt config tab.

Package.Name: colored by vehicle type (elektrosmoker´s vehicle type colors)
Package.Description:
LT = GREEN
MT = ORANGE
HT= GRAY
TD = BLUE
SPG = RED

Package.Name: OMC style
Package.Description: From the OMC XVM config

Package.Name: show max HP
Package.Description: shows maximal health points of tanks when battle starts (for allies and enemies)

Package.Name: On Key Press
Package.Description: Set the hp bars to be active on key press. (Usually left alt or left crtl)

Package.Name: On Always
Package.Description: Set the hp bars to be active always

Package.Name: Enable small hp numbers for every tank
Package.Description: Enable small numbers in the players panel showing the total hp of every tank. Taken from Willster419's config.

Package.Name: Enemy Spotted Marker
Package.Description: This is a Spotted Status Indicator for the enemy team.

Package.Name: Friends-Marker
Package.Description:
marks friends in allied/enemy playerspanel with a green dot,

it´s also possible to mark blacklisted tankers in allied/enemy playerspanel with a red dot.

if the tanksymbol is overlapping there´s an option to move the icon left/right

Package.Name: Blacklisted-Marker
Package.Description: marks blacklisted tankers in allied/enemy playerspanel with a red dot

Package.Name: change markers position (->) (if tankicons are overlapping)
Package.Description: move Friends-and Blacklisted-Markers more to center (if contouricons are overlapping)

Package.Name: Show who´s using XVM (xvmUserMarker)
Package.Description: shows a little orange "x" near to player-/tanknames when they are using xvm

Package.Name: change position of "x" (->)
Package.Description: move the "x" more to center (if contouricons are overlapping)

Package.Name: Snowflake Indicator
Package.Description: This mod shows a snowflake image for users with activated anonymizer or less than 100 battles.

Package.Name: Show language flag
Package.Description: will show the individually selcted language flag of every player in the panel.\n\nOn ALT key, it will be hidden.

Package.Name: change the flag´s position (<-)
Package.Description:
move flag to the panel inside.
useful for some prebuilt configs (eg Jimbo´s)



Attention with simultaneous use of both language-flags!
